function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Unrestricted access to disease data for public use may pose a risk of misinterpretation or misrepresentation, leading to panic or false conclusions.","Impact":"Public panic, misinformation, and misallocation of resources.","Mitigation":"Provide clear guidelines and disclaimers on data interpretation, and support data literacy education.","Technologies":"Data visualization tools with clear annotations and expert-reviewed dashboards.","People":"General public, researchers, public health officials.","Owner":"Researchers, public health officials, data scientists."},{"Description":"The use of non-peer-reviewed data for clinical practice may result in incorrect or harmful medical decisions.","Impact":"Incorrect diagnosis, treatment, or prevention strategies, leading to patient harm.","Mitigation":"Emphasize the non-peer-reviewed nature of the data, and use it as an aid to informed decision-making rather than a sole basis for clinical practice.","Technologies":"Data validation algorithms, automated alerts for non-peer-reviewed data.","People":"Healthcare professionals, clinicians, policymakers.","Owner":"Epidemiologists, public health officials."},{"Description":"Customization of dashboards and tracking of other countries may lead to biased data analysis or reporting, misrepresenting the true state of the outbreak.","Impact":"Inaccurate analysis, biased reporting, and distorted perception of the outbreak situation.","Mitigation":"Standardize data collection methods, provide clear guidelines on dashboard customization, and encourage diverse data sources.","Technologies":"Quality control algorithms, data standardization tools, diversity tracking features.","People":"Researchers, epidemiologists, public health officials.","Owner":"Data scientists, research institutions."}]}
